title: Political Parties in Russia and UK

content.question: Which of the following best explains the impact of electoral rules on the number of effective political parties in the legislatures in Russia and the United Kingdom?

choices.label: In Russia, electoral rules have resulted in competitive parties and a multiparty legislature, while in the United Kingdom, electoral rules have allowed regional parties to win a majority of seats in the legislature.

In Russia, electoral rules have made it difficult for parties to compete or gain representation in the legislature, while in the United Kingdom, single-member districts have resulted in a legislature with only two parties.
In Russia, single-member districts have resulted in a two-party dominant system, while in the United Kingdom, electoral rules limit minor parties and have resulted in a single-party dominant system.

In Russia, electoral rules have limited the number of parties in the legislature, while in the United Kingdom, electoral rules have allowed regional parties to win legislative seats while maintaining a system with two major parties.

content.answer: In Russia, electoral rules have limited the number of parties in the legislature, while in the United Kingdom, electoral rules have allowed regional parties to win legislative seats while maintaining a system with two major parties.
